metadata.title: RHSA-2023:2193: butane security, bug fix, and enhancement update (Moderate)
metadata.description:
Butane translates human-readable Butane Configs into machine-readable Ignition configs for provisioning operating systems that use Ignition.

The following packages have been upgraded to a later upstream version: butane (0.16.0). (BZ#2135475)

Security Fix(es):

* golang: net/http: handle server errors after sending GOAWAY (CVE-2022-27664)

* golang: math/big: decoding big.Float and big.Rat types can panic if the encoded message is too short, potentially allowing a denial of service (CVE-2022-32189)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

Additional Changes:

For detailed information on changes in this release, see the Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9.2 Release Notes linked from the References section.

bugzilla.text: golang: math/big: decoding big.Float and big.Rat types can panic if the encoded message is too short, potentially allowing a denial of service
golang: net/http: handle server errors after sending GOAWAY

criterions.comment: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9 is installed
butane is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
Red Hat Enterprise Linux must be installed
